verses.text: (ל) Why standest thou afar off, O \sc Lord\sc*? \add Why\add* hidest thou \add thyself\add* in times of trouble?
The wicked in \add his\add* pride doth persecute the poor: Let them be taken in the devices that they have imagined.
For the wicked boasteth of his heart’s desire, And blesseth the covetous, \add whom\add* the \sc Lord\sc* abhorreth.
The wicked, through the pride of his countenance, will not seek \add after God:\add* God \add is\add* not \add in\add* all his thoughts.
His ways are always grievous; Thy judgments \add are\add* far above out of his sight: \add As for\add* all his enemies, he puffeth at them.
He hath said in his heart, I shall not be moved: For \add I shall\add* never \add be\add* in adversity.
His mouth is full \add of\add* cursing and deceit and fraud: Under his tongue \add is\add* mischief and vanity.
He sitteth in the lurking places of the villages: In the secret places doth he murder the innocent: His eyes are privily set against the poor.
He lieth in wait secretly as a lion in his den: He lieth in wait to catch the poor: He doth catch the poor, when he draweth him into his net.
He croucheth, \add and\add* humbleth himself, That the poor may fall by his strong \add ones\add*.
He hath said in his heart, God hath forgotten: He hideth his face; he will never see \add it\add*.
(ק) Arise, O \sc Lord\sc*; O God, lift up thine hand: Forget not the humble.
Wherefore doth the wicked contemn God? He hath said in his heart, Thou wilt not require \add it\add*.
(ר) Thou hast seen \add it;\add* for thou beholdest mischief and spite, To requite \add it\add* with thy hand: The poor committeth \add himself\add* unto thee; Thou art the helper of the fatherless.
(ש) Break thou the arm of the wicked and the evil \add man:\add* Seek out his wickedness \add till\add* thou find none.
The \sc Lord\sc* \add is\add* King for ever and ever: The heathen are perished out of his land.
(ת) \sc Lord\sc*, thou hast heard the desire of the humble: Thou wilt prepare their heart, thou wilt cause thine ear to hear:
To judge the fatherless and the oppressed, That the man of the earth may no more oppress.
